title: Mover
location: NORTH CHICAGO, IL, US, 60064-1803, United States
description: Hourly WageISS offers a competitive compensation package including Benefits, Paid Time Off, and an hourly pay rate of $17.50USD Key PurposeThe Moves, Adds, and Changes Mover position is responsible for facilitating the movement of personal belongings and furniture between buildings in addition to assisting with meetings and events. This position will work closely with employees of ISS’ client and will require proper time management and project management. Duties will be dependent on operational needs as outlined by ISS’ clients and contracts. Success Criteria· Comply with safety rules, policies, and procedures· Perform work assignments in a team with other employees· Follow all company procedures, policies, and rules· Take direction and respond to supervision· Communicate with the lead, supervisor, co-workers, managers, and customers professionally· Use proper personal protective equipment· Present a professional appearance and conduct· Understand customer service and satisfaction· Understand reporting systems and the environment· Instilling trust· Commitment to the service values and ethics of the client company  Key Areas of Collaboration and Influence· A solid commitment to the guest experience· Always remember safety first· Build respectful relationships with all teammates and guests· Willingness to take directions from the Facility Manager, Key Account Manager, or District Manager· Coordinate activities with other internal departments  Ideal Candidate Experience· High school diploma/GED or an equivalent number of years of education and material moving experience· Must be able to understand and follow verbal and written instructions in English· Move experience is a plus· Excellent time management skills; able to organize and work independently· Must be a team player and committed to working in a quality environment· Demonstrates exceptional customer service skills· Ethical Conduct· Must be Results Driven· Must take Initiative· Computer proficiency skills· Material moving experience a plus· Experience with meeting and event planning is a plus   Key Accountabilities· Attending pre-move meetings to discuss the overall move plan and implementation strategy· Plan, organize and manage all phases of relocation requirements via onsite call center· Establish specific and detailed timelines to ensure that all move deadlines are met· Supply packing material and AbbVie Provided Equipment as required and requested· Prepare and deliver labels, move instructions, packing materials and other misc. items to each origin location in advance of move day as directed by the AbbVie move coordinator· Review all origin and destination move locations to ensure each employee's move needs are met as promised. Notify the designated move coordinator immediately of any requests for changes in scope before proceeding· Supply AbbVie owned “speed packs” (Gaylord boxes) for packing keyboards, cables, computer, and electronic equipment etc. as requested· Ensure there is adequate protection for carpeted hallways, door jams, doors & walls throughout the entire move· Adhere to and follow the label systems as mapped out by AbbVie personnel· Protect all furnishings and equipment from inclement weather· Provide sufficient resources and labor to complete all jobs on time and on budget· Respond to all same day, short notice work orders with a commitment of completion· Ability to provide supporting box truck as needed (on a special request basis)· Utilizing Conference Room Services and Call Center client work order requests, work with AbbVie Coordinator (or designate) to create a daily assignment timetable to complete set ups and have it coordinated with the daily move requests· Move furniture in and out of conference rooms as needed to accommodate the specific requests for our clients· Work closely with any assigned Technical Director(s) of Meetings & Events to ensure seamless event set ups· To have the ability to move large tables and AV equipment to unique events at AbbVie locations as well as other locations in northeastern Illinois/southeastern Wisconsin region  Physical Demands & Work Environment· Must be able to lift to 50 pounds· While performing the duties of this job, employee is frequently required to stand; walk; sit; use hands hands and fingers to touch, handle, grip, feel, grasp; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; talk or hear and taste or smell· Must occasionally lift and/or move up to 75 pounds· Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus· The employee is frequently exposed to moving mechanical parts; high, precarious places; fumes or airborne particles; toxic or caustic chemicals; outside weather conditions; risk of electrical shock and vibration· The employee is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions· The noise level in the work environment is frequently loud  As a global organization, ISS Group is committed to making the international community more resilient and just for all people. We encourage diversity and inclusion in their broadest terms, including ethnicity, race, age, gender, gender identity, disability, sexual orientation, religious beliefs, language, culture, and educational background. We look to lead our industry by example and to positively influence the market wherever we operate.

title: SITE MANAGER
description: SITE MANAGER ISS Facility Services Italy è TOP EMPLOYER 2023! ISS Facility Services è una multinazionale danese leader nel settore dei servizi integrati di Facility, in oltre trenta Paesi in tutto il mondo. In Italia, con oltre 1.000 collaboratori e collaboratrici, siamo Partner dei nostri Clienti, che ci scelgono perché progettiamo, gestiamo e manteniamo i loro ambienti di lavoro.  Attualmente stiamo ricercando un Site Manager che, a riporto del Key Account Manager, costituirà l’interfaccia principale per i clienti, ai quali dovrà garantire la qualità del servizio indicata nei contratti commerciali, nelle policies di Gruppo e nelle procedure interne. La nostra missioneConnecting people and places to make the world work betterIn ISS siamo tutti PLACEMAKERS: ognuno di noi lavora ogni giorno con l’obiettivo di rendere efficienti, sicuri e confortevoli sotto ogni aspetto i luoghi di lavoro dei nostri Clienti. Ci guidano cinque Valori: Honesty, Entrepreneurship, Quality, Unity & Responsibility, pilastri fondamentali della nostra cultura. Principali responsabilità: Gestione e coordinamento del personale cleaning/maintenance/Building ManagementGestione e redazione degli indicatori SLA e KPI di prestazione del servizioRedazione del conto economico di commessa, delle offerte al cliente e gestione ordini ai fornitoriSupporto al Responsabile di Commessa nella gestione ed erogazione dei servizi;Contribuire nell’identificazione delle esigenze del cliente e delle opportunità di sviluppo nell’area di competenza, nonché definizione di soluzioni risolutive in caso di problematiche legate al servizio.   Requisiti necessari: La risorsa possiede preferibilmente un titolo di studio tecnico e ha maturato notevole esperienza nella gestione di risorse nel settore Facility, ed è in grado di gestire sia l’aspetto operativo/tecnico, sia quello legato all’organizzazione del lavoro e delle misurazioni metriche da effettuare per garantire il servizio richiesto. Completano il profilo: Competenze nella gestione dei progetti: budget, tempi e qualità Competenze di contabilità e gestione finanziaria Conoscenza delle normative di manutenzione immobili D.L. 81/08 (specialmente in relazione al titolo quarto), competenze senior di impiantistica/edilizia Buona conoscenza della lingua ingleseUtilizzo del pacchetto Microsoft OfficeOttime capacità comunicative e doti relazionaliPropensione al problem solving Sede di lavoro: Roma  Range RAL: 28-33 K L’inquadramento economico proposto sarà commisurato in base all’esperienza del candidato. La ricerca è rivolta ad ambosessi (ex L.198/06) e a tutte le nazionalità (ex D. Lgs. 215/03 e D.Lgs. 216/03). ISS Facility Services Italy è TOP EMPLOYER 2023! ISS Facility Services è una multinazionale danese leader nel settore dei servizi integrati di Facility, in oltre trenta Paesi in tutto il mondo. title: Maintenance Tech II
description: Maintenance Technician Level II  ISS offers full time employees a variety of benefits including medical, dental, life and disability insurance, as well as a comprehensive leave program based on employment status. The hourly pay wage for this position is $22 per hour. Key Purpose The Maintenance Technician II reports directly to the Site Operations Manager to ensure all facilities related equipment are maintained to the highest standards in the Hard Services line . This role operates, maintain, and perform repairs on all conveyor systems to include mechanical, electrical, plumbing, lighting equipment and electrical controls and various other mechanical, electrical, and building systems in such a manner as to ensure optimal conditions. Provides Operations & Maintenance (O&M) for building systems of other facilities as assigned or directed.  Core functions of this role involve solving non-complex (single system) maintenance and repair of a building’s shell, core, and equipment. The purpose of this role is to maintain facilities for clients, customers, and staff in a safe operating condition; execute a best practice preventative and reactive maintenance program; and resolve immediate operational and/or building safety concerns. Ultimate success in this role is around providing safe and reliable building systems that proactively and reactively support our client’s business needs. This role will be asked to flexibly cover and augment roles in case of employee turnover or customer demand increases. Success Criteria Develop own skill base in line with agreed appraisal, taking responsibility for increased performance, and ensuring continued self-improvementParticipate and embrace the development opportunities within group Key Areas of Collaboration and InfluenceSupport the team, and report to the Facility ManagerCommunicate effectively with colleagues within the Business Unit and across the company so that information is disseminated effectively and participate in project groups and meetings as required Ideal Candidate Experience 3 to 5 years related technical experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experienceGraduation from 2- or 4-year program in technical emphasis from a community or regional collegeMinimum of 5 years’ experience in O&M and/or building Maintenance roles.Strong knowledge of Work Order Control procedures and Computerized Maintenance Management SystemsExperience with subcontractor and vendor contract managementExperience with managing key performance indicators as provided by Facility ManagerExperience with capacity planning and reportingAble to use hand tools, test equipment, and knowledge of maintenance shop practices with previous experience at the Journeyman level (Electrical and Mechanical Equipment systems)Must be able to use personal computers, MS Office (Word and Excel)Must have knowledge of mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of algebraAble to read, analyze, write procedure manuals, and interpret general business periodicals, journals, technical, procedures, or governmental regulationsAbility to effectively communicate through cell phone, email, conference calls, texting tools.  Key AccountabilitiesResponds in a professional, polite, and helpful manner when dealing with customersLearns, understands, and adheres with computer and phone policiesMaintains a clean and professional appearanceParticipates in training directed at increasing job-related skillsWorks according to schedule prepared and distributed by LeadershipWorks with and takes direction from LeadershipCompletes work order by utilizing a computerized maintenance work order systemTurn in receipts, invoices, and other documentation to appropriate person in a timely mannerEnsure Mechanical/ Electrical/ Storage space are kept neat, clean, orderly, and safeTroubleshooting ability with various equipment and voltages up to 277VACResponds to after-hour unscheduled emergencies as neededParticipates in On-Call rotation as assignedKnow and understand the Owner’s Building Operations/ Rules for the building(s) under your assignment as provided by LeadershipReport inventory of; spare parts, tools, and service equipment to LeadershipEnsure all spare parts, tools, and service equipment are kept in a neat and orderly mannerDispose of unusable spare parts under Leadership directionCoordinate with subcontractor and vendors as needed for the effective and safe accomplishment of maintenance and project work. This task includes review and enforce safety guidelines, ensure subcontractor and vendors access the facilities properly, be escorted to their work areas, and other safety precautions, work team debriefed, and safely escorted off site as neededPerforms other tasks as instructed including but not limited to plumbing, carpentry, general building maintenance, and assists other trades as necessaryAwareness and compliance of Government, State, City, Company, and client policies, procedures, and regulations  Physical Demands & Work EnvironmentWhile performing the duties of this Job, the employee is frequently exposed to moving mechanical parts; high, unsafe places; fumes/airborne particles; toxic or caustic chemicals; outside weather conditions; risk of electrical shock and vibration. title: Strahlenschutzwerker (m/w/d)
description: Die ISS Energy Services GmbH ist ein Tochterunternehmen der ISS Facility Services Holding GmbH. Sie ist aus den beiden ehemaligen ISS Tochterunternehmen ISS VSG und ISS EVANTEC hervorgegangen, deren Kernkompetenzen in der Energiebranche liegen. ISS VSG bot seit dem Jahr 2000 alle Leistungen des Facility Managements für Kunden in der Energiebranche. ISS EVANTEC hat sich seit über 30 Jahren auf technisch-infrastrukturelle und kerntechnische Dienstleistungen spezialisiert. Ihre AufgabenÜberwachen und Umsetzen der gesetzlichen Strahlenschutzvorschriften sowie innerbetrieblicher RegelungenArbeitsplatzüberwachung vor OrtMitarbeit bei der Festlegung von Strahlenschutzmaßnahmen und deren ÜberwachungMitarbeit bei FreigabemessungenMitarbeit bei der Durchführung von wiederkehrenden PrüfungenMitarbeit im Bereich AbfallbehandlungIhr ProfilErfolgreicher Abschluss der Prüfung zum Strahlenschutzwerker (VGB)Zeitlich nicht eingeschränkte Zuverlässigkeitsüberprüfung nach § 12bAtemschutztauglichkeit (G26)AtemschutzgrundausbildungGültige Untersuchung für strahlenexponierte PersonenErfahrung in kerntechnischen Anlagen und / oder ForschungseinrichtungenSelbständige strukturierte ArbeitsweiseTeam- und KommunikationsfähigkeitReisebereitschaft Wir bieten IhnenUmfangreiche und detaillierte EinarbeitungSicheren Arbeitsplatz Verantwortungsvolle und abwechslungsreiche TätigkeitLeistungsorientiertes EinkommenAngenehmes Betriebsklima und langfristige Zusammenarbeit stehen im VordergrundVergütung gem. TarifvertragBetriebliche AltersversorgungISS, ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Workplace Experience und Facility Management und bietet Lösungen, die zu einer besseren Unternehmensleistung beitragen, um das Leben einfacher, produktiver und angenehmer zu gestalten - und zwar nach hohen Standards. Von der Strategie bis hin zum Betrieb arbeitet ISS mit über 60.000 Kunden in mehr als 30 Ländern zusammen, um Orte zu schaffen, die arbeiten, denken und geben, und wird von 471.056 Mitarbeitern betreut, die jeden Tag Menschen und Orte miteinander verbinden. Im Jahr 2019 erwirtschaftete die ISS Einnahmen in Höhe von 78 Milliarden DKK. Der Hauptsitz der ISS befindet sich in Kopenhagen, Dänemark.

description: Die ISS Energy Services GmbH ist ein Tochterunternehmen der ISS Facility Services Holding GmbH. Sie ist aus den beiden ehemaligen ISS Tochterunternehmen ISS VSG und ISS EVANTEC hervorgegangen, deren Kernkompetenzen in der Energiebranche liegen. ISS VSG bot seit dem Jahr 2000 alle Leistungen des Facility Managements für Kunden in der Energiebranche. ISS EVANTEC hat sich seit über 30 Jahren auf technisch-infrastrukturelle und kerntechnische Dienstleistungen spezialisiert.Ingenieur Strahlenschutz (m/w/d) / Vollzeit Arbeitsort: Bundesweit in allen Kernkraftwerken Als Strahlenschutzingenieur (m/w/d) wirken Sie aktiv in Rückbauprojekten kerntechnischer Anlagen mit, begleiten Auflage- und Genehmigungsverfahren und setzen diese um. Ihre Aufgaben Planen, Vorbereiten, Koordinieren und Überwachen der Durchführung von radiologischen UntersuchungenErstellen von Betriebs-, Strahlenschutz- und Fachanweisungen sowie technischen BerichtenMitarbeit bei der Dokumentation und Auswertung von Analyseergebnissen und MesswertenMitwirken bei der Überwachung der Durchführung von Arbeiten im Rahmen der System- und Objektzuständigkeit des Kontrollbereiches bzw. ÜberwachungsbereichesMitarbeit bei der Einhaltung behördlicher Auflagen sowie bei der Planung von Anlagen unter strahlenschutztechnischen GesichtspunktenSteuerung, Abwicklung und Dokumentation von Freigabeverfahren nach §29 StrlSchVDokumentation für die Konditionierung jeweiliger radioaktiver AbfälleRecherchearbeiten zur Reststoff- und Anlagenhistorie und Erstellung von BerichtenDurchführung und Leitung von Besprechungen mit Kunden, Behörden und Gutachtern Ihr Profil Erfolgreicher Abschluss als Strahlenschutzingenieur (m/w/d) oder vergleichbare QualifikationErfahrung in der Kerntechnik, im Strahlenschutz oder der radiologischen MesstechnikKenntnisse im Strahlenschutzrecht und AtomgesetzVerhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und SchriftErweiterte Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Office-Produkten, insbesondere Word und ExcelTeamfähigkeit, Prozessdenken und eine strukturierte, eigenverantwortliche ArbeitsweiseReisebereitschaft Wir bieten IhnenUmfangreiche und detaillierte EinarbeitungSicheren Arbeitsplatz Verantwortungsvolle und abwechslungsreiche TätigkeitLeistungsorientiertes EinkommenAngenehmes Betriebsklima und langfristige Zusammenarbeit stehen im VordergrundVergütung gem. TarifvertragBetriebliche Altersversorgung ISS, ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Workplace Experience und Facility Management und bietet Lösungen, die zu einer besseren Unternehmensleistung beitragen, um das Leben einfacher, produktiver und angenehmer zu gestalten - und zwar nach hohen Standards. Von der Strategie bis hin zum Betrieb arbeitet ISS mit über 60.000 Kunden in mehr als 30 Ländern zusammen, um Orte zu schaffen, die arbeiten, denken und geben, und wird von 471.056 Mitarbeitern betreut, die jeden Tag Menschen und Orte miteinander verbinden. Im Jahr 2019 erwirtschaftete die ISS Einnahmen in Höhe von 78 Milliarden DKK. Der Hauptsitz der ISS befindet sich in Kopenhagen, Dänemark.

title: Servicetechniker Sicherheitstechnik/ Elektrotechnik (m/w/d)
description: Die ISS Engineering Services GmbH mit Sitz in Düsseldorf ist ein Tochterunternehmen der ISS Facility Services Holding GmbH. Im Zuge der globalen Key Account-Strategie sind die technischen Spezialkenntnisse und die technischen Serviceleistungen der ISS unter der ISS Engineering Services GmbH konsolidiert.  Wir suchen für die ISS Engineering Services GmbH einen oder mehrere Servicetechniker Sicherheitstechnik/ Elektrotechnik (m/w/d)  Arbeitsort: bundesweit Ihre Aufgaben Selbstständige Durchführung von Service-, Installations- und Instandhaltungsarbeiten an sicherheitstechnischen und elektrischen Anlagen gemäß VDE 0833/DIN 14675/VDE 0100Eigenständige störungsbedingte Fehlersuche und Instandsetzung der Sicherheitstechnik und Elektrotechnik, bei Bedarf Rücksprache mit Hersteller und technischen SupportWartung, Programmierung, Inbetriebnahme von sicherheitstechnischen Systemen, vorwiegend (BMA, EMA, SAA, ELA, ZK, SIBE etc.) der Hersteller Esser, Notifier, Honeywell, Hekatron, Telenot, Sonax, Hertek, Simax, RCS sowie der notstromtechnischen Hersteller CEAG, Inotec, Gessler, Beghelli, Kaufel, RZB etc.Führen und Pflegen von Fehler-, Prüf-, Wartungs- und Inspektionsberichten sowie Mitarbeit bei der Pflege der Anlagendokumentationen Ansprechpartner für Kunden und für alle am Serviceprozess beteiligtenZuarbeit zur Abrechnung und Angebotsbearbeitung Fachliche Aufgaben:Führung und Weiterleitung erforderlicher Projektdokumentation (z.B. Materialauflistungen, Leistungsauszüge, Wartungsformulare, Inspektions- und Instandhaltungsergebnisse)Weiterentwicklung von Auftragsvolumen und Erweiterung des Leistungsportfolios bei den KundenTeilnahme an Schulungsmaßnahmen und notwendigen betrieblichen UnterweisungenDurchführung der Auftragsabwicklung und BauleitungTerminüberwachung, -Änderungen und Detaillierungen in Absprache mit den KundenMontageüberwachung sowie Aufmaß Erstellung und/oder Aufmaß Prüfung Dokumentation aller außervertraglichen Leistungen (Zusatz-, Mehr- und Änderungsaufwand, Erfassung)Durchführung / Teilnahme von regelmäßigen internen Baubesprechungen und –Begehungen einschl. Dokumentation, sowie ggf. Teilnahme an externen Baubesprechungen.Bearbeitung der Mängelbeseitigung, Abarbeitung und Abmeldung von Restleistungen sowie MängelnLaufende Projektdokumentation (z. B. Bautagebücher, Bauprotokolle) Ihr ProfilEine abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung als Elektroniker / Elektriker oder Elektrotechniker mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung Selbständige und engagierte Arbeitsweise sowie Teamfähigkeit, Kommunikationsstärke, Flexibilität und BelastbarkeitPraktische Erfahrung im Bereich der Sicherheitstechnik und ElektrotechnikKenntnisse der einschlägigen Vorschriften, Normen und Richtlinien Gewerkübergreifende Kenntnisse von Vorteil Bereitschaft zur Übernahme von Notdiensten, in der Nacht und am WochenendeBedingte ReisebereitschaftGute Deutsch- und EDV-Kenntnisse sowie Bereitschaft zur eventuellen WeiterbildungFührerschein Kl. B erforderlichKosten- und Qualitätsbewusstsein sowie Kunden- und ServiceorientierungSelbstständige und verantwortungsbewusste ArbeitsweiseMehrjährige Berufserfahrung und sicherer Umgang in der Abwicklung von ServiceaufträgenSicherer Umgang mit gängigen MS-Office-Anwendungen Ausgeprägtes Verantwortungsbewusstsein, Eigeninitiative, Entscheidungsstärke und KonfliktfähigkeitOrganisationstalent, Kommunikationsfähigkeit Wir BietenEine Unternehmenskultur mit kurzen Kommunikationswegen, die es jedem Einzelnen ermöglicht, sein Potential bestmöglich zu entfalten und mit uns zu wachsen, z.B. durch Weiterbildungen im ISS CollegeBetriebliche AltersvorsorgeDie Vergütung erfolgt gemäß dem Firmentarifvertrag Mitarbeiterkonditionen mit vergünstigten Preisen bei Shopping-, Reise- und MietwagenportalenDen Rückhalt eines internationalen Unternehmens in einer wachsenden BrancheEinen zukunftssicheren Arbeitsplatz mit einer langfristigen Beschäftigungsperspektive. Firmenwagen inkl. Privatnutzung   ISS, ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Workplace Experience und Facility Management und bietet Lösungen, die zu einer besseren Unternehmensleistung beitragen, um das Leben einfacher, produktiver und angenehmer zu gestalten - und zwar nach hohen Standards. Von der Strategie bis hin zum Betrieb arbeitet ISS mit über 60.000 Kunden in mehr als 30 Ländern zusammen, um Orte zu schaffen, die arbeiten, denken und geben, und wird von 471.056 Mitarbeitern betreut, die jeden Tag Menschen und Orte miteinander verbinden. Im Jahr 2019 erwirtschaftete die ISS Einnahmen in Höhe von 78 Milliarden DKK. Der Hauptsitz der ISS befindet sich in Kopenhagen, Dänemark.

title: Mitarbeiter Empfang (m/w/d)
description: ISS, ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Workplace Experience und Facility Management, schafft Raumlösungen, die zu einer besseren Unternehmensleistung beitragen und das Leben einfacher, produktiver und angenehmer machen – nach hohen Standards geliefert von engagierten Menschen.   Die ISS Energy Services GmbH ist ein Tochterunternehmen der ISS Facility Services Holding GmbH. Sie ist aus den beiden ehemaligen ISS Tochterunternehmen ISS VSG und ISS EVANTEC hervorgegangen, deren Kernkompetenzen in der Energiebranche liegen. ISS VSG bot seit dem Jahr 2000 alle Leistungen des Facility Managements für Kunden in der Energiebranche. title: Meister Elektrotechnik (m/w/d)
description: Die ISS TeGeMa GmbH mit Hauptsitz in Lübbenau gehört zur ISS Unternehmensgruppe und ist spezialisiert auf die Errichtung und Ausrüstung der elektrischen, sicherheits- und kommunikations- technischen Infrastruktur in Zweckbauten, Industrie- und Gewerbeanlagen. Das Unternehmen bietet in den Regionen Brandenburg, Berlin und Sachsen Dienstleistungen von der Projektplanung über die Bauausführung, Wartung und 24-Stunden-Störungsdienst an. Zu Ihren Aufgaben zählen unter anderem:Verantwortung für die gesamte Abwicklung und Steuerung der Projekte aus technischer und kaufmännischer SichtSicherstellung der Wirtschaftlichkeit der Projekte Überwachung aller Planungs- und BauaktivitätenAnsprechpartner für unsere Kunden und Mitarbeiter Fachliche und disziplinarische Führung der Projektteams Ihre Qualifikationen und persönlichen Fähigkeiten:Abgeschlossenes Studium (z.B. Elektrotechnik) oder vergleichbare Qualifikation (Elektromeister)Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung Fundierte technische und betriebswirtschaftliche Kenntnisse Organisatorische Fähigkeiten sowie strukturierte und zielorientierte ArbeitsweiseUmfangreiche Kenntnisse der technischen Anlagen und der entsprechenden Vorschriften, Vergaberecht VOB/B, VDE, BGB sowie allgemeines VertragsrechtEigeninitiative, Selbständigkeit und DurchsetzungsvermögenKundenorientierung und Kommunikationsstärke Wir bieten:Eine Unternehmenskultur mit kurzen Kommunikationswegen, die es jedem Einzelnen ermöglicht, sein Potential bestmöglich zu entfalten und mit uns zu wachsen, z.B. durch Weiterbildungen im ISS CollegeUmfangreiche und detaillierte EinarbeitungSicheren ArbeitsplatzVerantwortungsvolle und abwechslungsreiche TätigkeitLeistungsorientiertes EinkommenAngenehmes Betriebsklima und langfristige Zusammenarbeit stehen im Vordergrund ISS, ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Workplace Experience und Facility Management und bietet Lösungen, die zu einer besseren Unternehmensleistung beitragen, um das Leben einfacher, produktiver und angenehmer zu gestalten - und zwar nach hohen Standards. title: Receptionist
description: Receptionist- Hello Host Hourly WageISS offers full time employees a variety of benefits including medical, dental, life and disability insurance, as well as a comprehensive leave program based on employment status. The hourly pay for this position is $19.00 per hour HoursHours of operation are 7:00am to 4:00pm Monday to Friday Key PurposeProvide superior hospitality while meeting and greeting all visitors and guests. Always representing both ISS and our Client in the most professional manners. Success Criteria Provide an all-round and amazing colleague experience, taking customer service to the next level.Meet & exceed agreed experiential service levelsBuild effective relationships with ISS employees to ensure we create a placemaking ethos and exceed in all elements of the touchpoint journeyEnsuring a safe working environment in line with Health and Safety regulations and standards Ideal Candidate ExperienceHigh school diploma or equivalent education required. College Degree Preferred.Two years related experience in a corporate environment or hospitality related field preferredKnowledgeable of Microsoft Office applicationsGreat telephone skills and verbal communicationMust be client-driven, organized, and professionalAbility to work in a team environment Key AccountabilitiesYou are a natural host and can make guests and colleagues feel at home within the workplace.You are the primary connector between colleagues and the workplace, willingly responding to queries & resolve issues relating to the physical environment, technology & security first-line fixes. You learn quickly and will enjoy being able to promote various destinations, food services, wellness events, and activities.Develop relationships and capture guests & colleagues' individual preferences/needs for future visits and think creatively of ways to accommodate any special requests.Eyes wide open – always looking at our workplaces and experiences through the lens of a colleague or visitor.You will drive and participate in working groups to capture colleague feedback and build engagement.We function as One Team and work with our peers by notifying the appropriate Departments when an extra pair of hands or specialist support (e.g., tech) is needed.Undertake tours of the entire building while stating facts and having a positive demeanor. Be involved in reviewing and enhancing operating procedures – making sure that they remain relevant and helping to adjust and amend them on a regular basis.You will be the ‘storyteller for success,’ actively highlighting the positive effect we are having on our colleagues every dayAssist the Curated Team with activationsComplete checklists for floor walks to engage with colleagues and to report all equipment that is malfunctioning.Conduct daily inspections in all conference/focus rooms and communal areasRaise tickets for all facilities inquiries and send reports weekly for all BeOne app issuesConduct Campus Tours when neededReply to all emails regarding any concerns/issues for visitors, colleague engagement, etc. Physical Demands & Work EnvironmentCome to work properly dressed according to the dress code for this positionEmployee must be able to work under pressure and time deadlines during peak periods.Sitting at a computer for extended periods of time 90% of the timeMust be able to lift a minimum of 10 pounds  As a global organization ISS Group is committed to making the international community more resilient and just for all people. We encourage diversity and inclusion in their broadest terms, including ethnicity, race, age, gender, gender identity, disability, sexual orientation, religious beliefs, language, culture, and educational background. We look to lead our industry by example and positively influence the market wherever we operate.

title: Dishwasher
description: Dishwasher  Hourly Wage ISS offers full-time employees a variety of benefits including medical, dental, life and disability insurance, as well as a comprehensive leave program based on employment status. The hourly pay range for this position is $16.50 - $16.75 per hour.  Work Hours The work hours for this position are Monday – Friday 7:00am - 3:30pm   Key Purpose Wash pots and pans, wash dishes, maintain floors.   Assist with general cleaning and sanitation as assigned. Maintain storage areas and equipment as assigned.   Success Criteria Passion for customer service Positive attitude Dependable Ability to communicate effectively and work within a team environment   Key Areas of Collaboration and Influence Work with catering to deliver food and assist with the setup of events Work well under time restraints Realize the importance of a team working environment Commitment to the service values and ethics of the client managers Ability to understand and follow direction from chefs and managers Supporting the Chef and culinary team when needed Supporting dish room operators as needed   Ideal Candidate Experience Knowledge of HACCP practices for handling dishware and food deliveries Passion of customer service A positive attitude Accountability and dependable in all that you do Ability to communicate with teammates   Key Accountabilities Setup pot sink correctly according to HACCP practices and wash pots and pans as required, putting them away as them as directed Clean or sanitize work areas, utensils, or equipment Sweep and mop floors in the kitchen and service areas as required Remove garbage as directed in a safe manner Performs other duties as assigned Must follow all safety rules and actively prevent accidents   Physical Demands & Work Environment Work up to 8 hours a day on your feet, excluding breaks Must be able to lift a minimum of 25lbs Come to work properly dressed according to the dress code Employee must be able to work under pressure and time deadlines during peak periods  As a global organization, ISS Group is committed to making the international community more resilient and just for all people. We encourage diversity and inclusion in their broadest terms, including ethnicity, race, age, gender, gender identity, disability, sexual orientation, religious beliefs, language, culture, and educational background. We look to lead our industry by example and to positively influence the market wherever we operate.   ISS, a leading workplace experience and facility management company, provides placemaking solutions that contribute to better business performance and makes life easier, more productive and enjoyable – delivered to high standards by people who care. ISS believes that people make places and places make people. From strategy through to operations, ISS partners with over 60,000 customers in 30+ countries to deliver places that work, think and give and is served by 471,056 employees who connect people and places every single day. In 2019, ISS earned DKK 78 billion in revenue. It is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark.

title: Cook

title: Weekend arbejde hos hypermarked i Skalborg
description: Ansøgningsfrist: 30.juni 2023 Vi søger 2 medarbejdere til vores team hos kunde i Skalborg.Vil du være med til at sikre en god kvalitet der kan tåle fødevarekontrollens tjek. Så læs endelig videre.Du er som medarbejder kvalitetsbevidst, pligtopfyldende, fleksibel og fuld af gåpåmod. Hos ISS bliver du en del af en global serviceorganisation, der ånder for at yde den bedste service for vores kunder. At være en del af ISSSom vores nye kollega, bliver du en del af et spændende arbejdsmiljø, hvor vi sætter en ære i at levere rengøring på et højt niveau. Dine arbejdsopgaver vil primært bestå i at udføre rengøring bageri eller slagteri afdeling hos et hypermarked, har du erfaring med rengøring er det en fordel, men det vigtigste er, at du er detaljeorienteret og har sans for de små detaljer samt er fleksibel og omstillingsparat. Vi har rengøringsopgaver primært om aften/natten. Der vil være mulighed for at få ekstra timer ved sygdom og ferie i hverdagene. Stilling 1 Bager rengøringFredag + lørdag i lige uger, kl.19:00 – 02:30 inkl. 0,5 time selvbetalt pauseStilling 2 Slagter rengøringHver lørdag, kl.22:15 – 04:45 inkl. 0,5 time selvbetalt pause.Udover ovennævnte kompetencer, ser vi gerne at du: Er selvstændig og kan tage ansvar for egne opgaverArbejder i et raskt tempoEr fokuseret, proaktiv og god til at læse kundens behovEr god til at indgå i et team og at samarbejde med andreKan tale og forstå både dansk og engelsk   ISS lever af service - det er derfor også vigtigt, at du er smilende, præsentabel og imødekommende over for både kunder og kolleger, samt er villig til at gøre en forskel for vores kunder. AnsøgningIndsend dit CV, motiveret ansøgning og andre relevante dokumenter via linket 'Ansøg nu' hurtigst muligt og senest d. 30. juni. Vi afholder samtaler løbende, så send din ansøgning i dag frem for i morgen – det kan være dig, vi leder efter.Vi stræber efter at afvikle en inkluderende og retfærdig rekrutteringsproces og lige muligheder for alle kandidater. Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Remé Andersen på 29264973.Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig! ISS is a Place to Be YouBe who you are. Become what you want. Be part of something bigger.Since 1901, ISS has been a people-first company. Diversity and inclusion have always been in our DNA, and our diverse workforce has played a critical role in fostering our innovation and financial growth, expanding our global footprint and positively influencing our company culture. This includes the diversity of age, ethnicity, gender, disabilities, religious beliefs, and cultural backgrounds among others. We recognize the power of diversity and celebrate the differences that makes us unique.We seek to be a place of belonging and create places where people are respected, embraced, and valued for exactly who they are. We take our social obligation seriously to improve lives, make a difference in our communities, and protect our planet. Because when we get things right, the world works better. And that is what drives us.  dk.issworld.com#APlacetoBeYou #LI-DNI

Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Remé Andersen på 29264973.Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig! ISS is a Place to Be YouBe who you are. Become what you want. Be part of something bigger.Since 1901, ISS has been a people-first company. This includes the diversity of age, ethnicity, gender, disabilities, religious beliefs, and cultural backgrounds among others. title: Barselsvikar søges til kantine i Odense Er du faglært har en passion for mad - og kan du godt lide
description: Ansøgningsfrist: 26. juni 2023 Er du faglært har en passion for mad – og kan du godt lide at udvikle dig og nytænke retter? Så er dette måske jobbet for dig! Vi søger lige nu en faglært barselsvikar til en af vores kantiner i Odense. Du vil i tæt samarbejde med køkkenchefen være ansvarlig for at servere sund, inspirerende og velsmagende mad til 40-60 gæster. I kantinen er der fokus på sæsonvarer, og der tilbydes morgenmad, frokost samt mødeforplejning til gæsterne.  Da vi er en servicevirksomhed, er det vigtigt, at du er med til at yde den bedste service for vores gæster. Du bliver en del af et team, hvor stemningen er i top og humøret er højt. Du skal derfor være positivt indstillet og have den samme passion for mad og service, som vi har. Samtidig er der hos os plads til, at du kan udvikle dig og nytænke retterne, så gæsterne hver dag får en god spiseoplevelse.  Stillingen er på 37 timer ugentligt med mødetid kl. 06.00-15.00 mandag til fredag.  Vi forventer startdato hurtigst muligt og barselsvikariatet vil vare indtil februar 2024. Den rette kandidat kan sige ja til følgende: Du er faglært kok eller lignende og sætter en ære i at levere på et højt niveau hver dag Du er udadvendt og kan lide at yde en god service til gæsterneDu har øje for anretning og følger med i tidens trendsDu trives i en travl hverdag, hvor vi hjælper hinandenDu er en teamplayer og besidder gode samarbejdsevner, idet du forstår, at vi kun kommer i mål som et team  Ansøgning Lyder stillingen som barselsvikar i vores kantine i Odense som noget for dig, så indsend dit CV, motiveret ansøgning og andre relevante dokumenter via linket 'Ansøg nu' hurtigst muligt og senest d. 26. juni 2023. Vi afholder samtaler løbende, så send din ansøgning i dag frem for i morgen – det kan være dig, vi leder efter.Vi stræber efter at afvikle en inkluderende og retfærdig rekrutteringsproces og lige muligheder for alle kandidater. Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte køkkenchef Heidi Bøgebjerg Rasmussen på tlf: 71 96 59 39 i tidsrummet fra kl. 13:00 – 14:00.Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!  ISS is a Place to Be YouBe who you are. Become what you want. Be part of something bigger.Since 1901, ISS has been a people-first company. Diversity and inclusion have always been in our DNA, and our diverse workforce has played a critical role in fostering our innovation and financial growth, expanding our global footprint and positively influencing our company culture. This includes the diversity of age, ethnicity, gender, disabilities, religious beliefs, and cultural backgrounds among others. We recognize the power of diversity and celebrate the differences that makes us unique.We seek to be a place of belonging and create places where people are respected, embraced, and valued for exactly who they are. We take our social obligation seriously to improve lives, make a difference in our communities, and protect our planet. Because when we get things right, the world works better. And that is what drives us.  dk.issworld.com#APlacetoBeYou #LI-DNI

title: Digital Workplace Specialist - Endpoint Management
description: ISS connects people and places to make the world work better. Are you ready to connect to a place where you belong? At our corporate facilities or at client sites – together, we make places while transforming businesses into having even more positive impact on societies, the environment, and our people. We are searching for experienced Digital Workplace operations specialists to join our Level 2 Digital Workplace operations team. You will join a newly established support organization based out of different ISS countries. In this role you will provide 2nd level support to ISS global end point services. Services cover wide technical scope, but you are not expected to be experienced in all listed below areas.  Your Key Responsibilities:Service requests fulfillment and incidents resolution in the following endpoint management areas:Azure VDI:Application installation / publicationSession host creation / pool creation and updateOn-premises GPO management related to Azure VDIMicrosoft Endpoint Configuration Manager (SCCM) Application package creation / distributionAbility to troubleshoot ConfigMgr client logs and package installation logsOS/MS Office/Software Updates managementoperating system deployment via MEMCM, AutopilotMobile device management (Intune) – Windows, iOS, AndroidTroubleshoot and resolve out of the ordinary technical problems and challengesCollaboration with various stakeholders within the IT landscape (Network team, Security team etc.) and close collaboration with Level 3 engineering team Contribution to Knowledge base development (Develop and maintain repeatable processes documents that govern the configuration, administration and maintenance, best practices, SOPs)Ensuring Customer satisfaction and SLA adherence  Professional & Personal Qualifications:At least 2 years of experience with listed below technologies:SCCM/Configuration ManagerApplication deployment systems, SCCM, WSUS, PDQ, etc.-Endpoint Management (formerly Intune),Familiarity with at least one of the virtualized client technologiesVDI Azure, Citrix Virtual apps, VMware Horizon Experienced in working with ITIL processes (working with ITSM platforms like Jira, Confluence or similar)Experience with client virtualization technologiesCertifications relevant within the area of responsibility for the position are a plus.Fluent English, both written and oral On a personal level you can work independently and stay organized when assigned multiple tasks. Why ISSSince our founding in 1901, ISS has been a people-first company. We recognize the power of diversity and celebrate the differences that make us unique. When everyone is free to be themselves, everyone benefits. Our people feel safe, respected, represented, and supported as their authentic selves, allowing them to seize opportunities and reach their full potential. We take seriously our obligation to improve lives, make a difference in our communities, and protect our planet - because when we get things right, the world works better. And that is what drives us. ISS is a Place to Be You.Be who you are. Become what you want. Be part of something bigger.Become more. Become ISS. How you’ll applyApply directly via the link on this page by submitting a cover letter, CV and other relevant documents for the position you are applying for.We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible. ISS seeks to BE a place of belonging and CREATE places where every person is welcomed, embraced, and valued for exactly who they are. Places where people feel safe, respected, represented, and supported as their authentic selves.

title: Mover
location: NORTH CHICAGO, IL, US, 60064-1803, United States
description: Hourly WageISS offers a competitive compensation package including Benefits, Paid Time Off, and an hourly pay rate of $17.50USD Key PurposeThe Moves, Adds, and Changes Mover position is responsible for facilitating the movement of personal belongings and furniture between buildings in addition to assisting with meetings and events. This position will work closely with employees of ISS’ client and will require proper time management and project management. Duties will be dependent on operational needs as outlined by ISS’ clients and contracts. Success Criteria· Comply with safety rules, policies, and procedures· Perform work assignments in a team with other employees· Follow all company procedures, policies, and rules· Take direction and respond to supervision· Communicate with the lead, supervisor, co-workers, managers, and customers professionally· Use proper personal protective equipment· Present a professional appearance and conduct· Understand customer service and satisfaction· Understand reporting systems and the environment· Instilling trust· Commitment to the service values and ethics of the client company  Key Areas of Collaboration and Influence· A solid commitment to the guest experience· Always remember safety first· Build respectful relationships with all teammates and guests· Willingness to take directions from the Facility Manager, Key Account Manager, or District Manager· Coordinate activities with other internal departments  Ideal Candidate Experience· High school diploma/GED or an equivalent number of years of education and material moving experience· Must be able to understand and follow verbal and written instructions in English· Move experience is a plus· Excellent time management skills; able to organize and work independently· Must be a team player and committed to working in a quality environment· Demonstrates exceptional customer service skills· Ethical Conduct· Must be Results Driven· Must take Initiative· Computer proficiency skills· Material moving experience a plus· Experience with meeting and event planning is a plus   Key Accountabilities· Attending pre-move meetings to discuss the overall move plan and implementation strategy· Plan, organize and manage all phases of relocation requirements via onsite call center· Establish specific and detailed timelines to ensure that all move deadlines are met· Supply packing material and AbbVie Provided Equipment as required and requested· Prepare and deliver labels, move instructions, packing materials and other misc. items to each origin location in advance of move day as directed by the AbbVie move coordinator· Review all origin and destination move locations to ensure each employee's move needs are met as promised. Notify the designated move coordinator immediately of any requests for changes in scope before proceeding· Supply AbbVie owned “speed packs” (Gaylord boxes) for packing keyboards, cables, computer, and electronic equipment etc. as requested· Ensure there is adequate protection for carpeted hallways, door jams, doors & walls throughout the entire move· Adhere to and follow the label systems as mapped out by AbbVie personnel· Protect all furnishings and equipment from inclement weather· Provide sufficient resources and labor to complete all jobs on time and on budget· Respond to all same day, short notice work orders with a commitment of completion· Ability to provide supporting box truck as needed (on a special request basis)· Utilizing Conference Room Services and Call Center client work order requests, work with AbbVie Coordinator (or designate) to create a daily assignment timetable to complete set ups and have it coordinated with the daily move requests· Move furniture in and out of conference rooms as needed to accommodate the specific requests for our clients· Work closely with any assigned Technical Director(s) of Meetings & Events to ensure seamless event set ups· To have the ability to move large tables and AV equipment to unique events at AbbVie locations as well as other locations in northeastern Illinois/southeastern Wisconsin region  Physical Demands & Work Environment· Must be able to lift to 50 pounds· While performing the duties of this job, employee is frequently required to stand; walk; sit; use hands hands and fingers to touch, handle, grip, feel, grasp; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; talk or hear and taste or smell· Must occasionally lift and/or move up to 75 pounds· Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus· The employee is frequently exposed to moving mechanical parts; high, precarious places; fumes or airborne particles; toxic or caustic chemicals; outside weather conditions; risk of electrical shock and vibration· The employee is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions· The noise level in the work environment is frequently loud  As a global organization, ISS Group is committed to making the international community more resilient and just for all people. We encourage diversity and inclusion in their broadest terms, including ethnicity, race, age, gender, gender identity, disability, sexual orientation, religious beliefs, language, culture, and educational background. We look to lead our industry by example and to positively influence the market wherever we operate.

title: SITE MANAGER
description: SITE MANAGER ISS Facility Services Italy è TOP EMPLOYER 2023! ISS Facility Services è una multinazionale danese leader nel settore dei servizi integrati di Facility, in oltre trenta Paesi in tutto il mondo. In Italia, con oltre 1.000 collaboratori e collaboratrici, siamo Partner dei nostri Clienti, che ci scelgono perché progettiamo, gestiamo e manteniamo i loro ambienti di lavoro.  Attualmente stiamo ricercando un Site Manager che, a riporto del Key Account Manager, costituirà l’interfaccia principale per i clienti, ai quali dovrà garantire la qualità del servizio indicata nei contratti commerciali, nelle policies di Gruppo e nelle procedure interne. La nostra missioneConnecting people and places to make the world work betterIn ISS siamo tutti PLACEMAKERS: ognuno di noi lavora ogni giorno con l’obiettivo di rendere efficienti, sicuri e confortevoli sotto ogni aspetto i luoghi di lavoro dei nostri Clienti. Ci guidano cinque Valori: Honesty, Entrepreneurship, Quality, Unity & Responsibility, pilastri fondamentali della nostra cultura. Principali responsabilità: Gestione e coordinamento del personale cleaning/maintenance/Building ManagementGestione e redazione degli indicatori SLA e KPI di prestazione del servizioRedazione del conto economico di commessa, delle offerte al cliente e gestione ordini ai fornitoriSupporto al Responsabile di Commessa nella gestione ed erogazione dei servizi;Contribuire nell’identificazione delle esigenze del cliente e delle opportunità di sviluppo nell’area di competenza, nonché definizione di soluzioni risolutive in caso di problematiche legate al servizio.   Requisiti necessari: La risorsa possiede preferibilmente un titolo di studio tecnico e ha maturato notevole esperienza nella gestione di risorse nel settore Facility, ed è in grado di gestire sia l’aspetto operativo/tecnico, sia quello legato all’organizzazione del lavoro e delle misurazioni metriche da effettuare per garantire il servizio richiesto. Completano il profilo: Competenze nella gestione dei progetti: budget, tempi e qualità Competenze di contabilità e gestione finanziaria Conoscenza delle normative di manutenzione immobili D.L. 81/08 (specialmente in relazione al titolo quarto), competenze senior di impiantistica/edilizia Buona conoscenza della lingua ingleseUtilizzo del pacchetto Microsoft OfficeOttime capacità comunicative e doti relazionaliPropensione al problem solving Sede di lavoro: Roma  Range RAL: 28-33 K L’inquadramento economico proposto sarà commisurato in base all’esperienza del candidato. La ricerca è rivolta ad ambosessi (ex L.198/06) e a tutte le nazionalità (ex D. Lgs. 215/03 e D.Lgs. 216/03).

title: Maintenance Tech II
description: Maintenance Technician Level II  ISS offers full time employees a variety of benefits including medical, dental, life and disability insurance, as well as a comprehensive leave program based on employment status. The hourly pay wage for this position is $22 per hour. Key Purpose The Maintenance Technician II reports directly to the Site Operations Manager to ensure all facilities related equipment are maintained to the highest standards in the Hard Services line . This role operates, maintain, and perform repairs on all conveyor systems to include mechanical, electrical, plumbing, lighting equipment and electrical controls and various other mechanical, electrical, and building systems in such a manner as to ensure optimal conditions. Provides Operations & Maintenance (O&M) for building systems of other facilities as assigned or directed.  Core functions of this role involve solving non-complex (single system) maintenance and repair of a building’s shell, core, and equipment. The purpose of this role is to maintain facilities for clients, customers, and staff in a safe operating condition; execute a best practice preventative and reactive maintenance program; and resolve immediate operational and/or building safety concerns. Ultimate success in this role is around providing safe and reliable building systems that proactively and reactively support our client’s business needs. This role will be asked to flexibly cover and augment roles in case of employee turnover or customer demand increases. Success Criteria Develop own skill base in line with agreed appraisal, taking Das Unternehmen bietet in den Regionen Brandenburg, Berlin und Sachsen Dienstleistungen von der Projektplanung über die Bauausführung, Wartung und 24-Stunden-Störungsdienst an. Zu Ihren Aufgaben zählen unter anderem:Verantwortung für die gesamte Abwicklung und Steuerung der Projekte aus technischer und kaufmännischer SichtSicherstellung der Wirtschaftlichkeit der Projekte Überwachung aller Planungs- und BauaktivitätenAnsprechpartner für unsere Kunden und Mitarbeiter Fachliche und disziplinarische Führung der Projektteams Ihre Qualifikationen und persönlichen Fähigkeiten:Abgeschlossenes Studium (z.B. Elektrotechnik) oder vergleichbare Qualifikation (Elektromeister)Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung Fundierte technische und betriebswirtschaftliche Kenntnisse Organisatorische Fähigkeiten sowie strukturierte und zielorientierte ArbeitsweiseUmfangreiche Kenntnisse der technischen Anlagen und der entsprechenden Vorschriften, Vergaberecht VOB/B, VDE, BGB sowie allgemeines VertragsrechtEigeninitiative, Selbständigkeit und DurchsetzungsvermögenKundenorientierung und Kommunikationsstärke Wir bieten:Eine Unternehmenskultur mit kurzen Kommunikationswegen, die es jedem Einzelnen ermöglicht, sein Potential bestmöglich zu entfalten und mit uns zu wachsen, z.B. durch Weiterbildungen im ISS CollegeUmfangreiche und detaillierte EinarbeitungSicheren ArbeitsplatzVerantwortungsvolle und abwechslungsreiche TätigkeitLeistungsorientiertes EinkommenAngenehmes Betriebsklima und langfristige Zusammenarbeit stehen im Vordergrund ISS, ein führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Workplace Experience und Facility Management und bietet Lösungen, die zu einer besseren Unternehmensleistung beitragen, um das Leben einfacher, produktiver und angenehmer zu gestalten - und zwar nach hohen Standards. Von der Strategie bis hin zum Betrieb arbeitet ISS mit über 60.000 Kunden in mehr als 30 Ländern zusammen, um Orte zu schaffen, die arbeiten, denken und geben, und wird von 471.056 Mitarbeitern betreut, die jeden Tag Menschen und Orte miteinander verbinden. Im Jahr 2019 erwirtschaftete die ISS Einnahmen in Höhe von 78 Milliarden DKK. Der Hauptsitz der ISS befindet sich in Kopenhagen, Dänemark.

title: Receptionist
description: Receptionist- Hello Host Hourly WageISS offers full time employees a variety of benefits including medical, dental, life and disability insurance, as well as a comprehensive leave program based on employment status. The hourly pay for this position is $19.00 per hour HoursHours of operation are 7:00am to 4:00pm Monday to Friday Key PurposeProvide superior hospitality while meeting and greeting all visitors and guests. Always representing both ISS and our Client in the most professional manners. Success Criteria Provide an all-round and amazing colleague experience, taking customer service to the next level.Meet & exceed agreed experiential service levelsBuild effective relationships with ISS employees to ensure we create a placemaking ethos and exceed in all elements of the touchpoint journeyEnsuring a safe working environment in line with Health and Safety regulations and standards Ideal Candidate ExperienceHigh school diploma or equivalent education required. College Degree Preferred.Two years related experience in a corporate environment or hospitality related field preferredKnowledgeable of Microsoft Office applicationsGreat telephone skills and verbal communicationMust be client-driven, organized, and professionalAbility to work in a team environment Key AccountabilitiesYou are a natural host and can make guests and colleagues feel at home within the workplace.You are the primary connector between colleagues and the workplace, willingly responding to queries & resolve issues relating to the physical environment, technology & security first-line fixes. You learn quickly and will enjoy being able to promote various destinations, food services, wellness events, and activities.Develop relationships and capture guests & colleagues' individual preferences/needs for future visits and think creatively of ways to accommodate any special requests.Eyes wide open – always looking at our workplaces and experiences through the lens of a colleague or visitor.You will drive and participate in working groups to capture colleague feedback and build engagement.We function as One Team and work with our peers by notifying the appropriate Departments when an extra pair of hands or specialist support (e.g., tech) is needed.Undertake tours of the entire building while stating facts and having a positive demeanor. Be involved in reviewing and enhancing operating procedures – making sure that they remain relevant and helping to adjust and amend them on a regular basis.You will be the ‘storyteller for success,’ actively highlighting the positive effect we are having on our colleagues every dayAssist the Curated Team with activationsComplete checklists for floor walks to engage with colleagues and to report all equipment that is malfunctioning.Conduct daily inspections in all conference/focus rooms and communal areasRaise tickets for all facilities inquiries and send reports weekly for all BeOne app issuesConduct Campus Tours when neededReply to all emails regarding any concerns/issues for visitors, colleague engagement, etc. Physical Demands & Work EnvironmentCome to work properly dressed according to the dress code for this positionEmployee must be able to work under pressure and time deadlines during peak periods.Sitting at a computer for extended periods of time 90% of the timeMust be able to lift a minimum of 10 pounds  As a global organization ISS Group is committed to making the international community more resilient and just for all people. We encourage diversity and inclusion in their broadest terms, including ethnicity, race, age, gender, gender identity, disability, sexual orientation, religious beliefs, language, culture, and educational background. We look to lead our industry by example and positively influence the market wherever we operate.

title: Dishwasher
description: Dishwasher  Hourly Wage ISS offers full-time employees a variety of benefits including medical, dental, life and disability insurance, as well as a comprehensive leave program based on employment status. The hourly pay range for this position is $16.50 - $16.75 per hour.  Work Hours The work hours for this position are Monday – Friday 7:00am - 3:30pm   Key Purpose Wash pots and pans, wash dishes, maintain floors.   Assist with general cleaning and sanitation as assigned. Maintain storage areas and equipment as assigned.   Success Criteria Passion for customer service Positive attitude Dependable Ability to communicate effectively and work within a team environment   Key Areas of Collaboration and Influence Work with catering to deliver food and assist with the setup of events Work well under time restraints Realize the importance of a team working environment Commitment to the service values and ethics of the client managers Ability to understand and follow direction from chefs and managers Supporting the Chef and culinary team when needed Supporting dish room operators as needed   Ideal Candidate Experience Knowledge of HACCP practices for handling dishware and food deliveries Passion of customer service A positive attitude Accountability and dependable in all that you do Ability to communicate with teammates   Key Accountabilities Setup pot sink correctly according to HACCP practices and wash pots and pans as required, putting them away as them as directed Clean or sanitize work areas, utensils, or equipment Sweep and mop floors in the kitchen and service areas as required Remove garbage as directed in a safe manner Performs other duties as assigned Must follow all safety rules and actively prevent accidents   Physical Demands & Work Environment Work up to 8 hours a day on your feet, excluding breaks Must be able to lift a minimum of 25lbs Come to work properly dressed according to the dress code Employee must be able to work under pressure and time deadlines during peak periods  As a global organization, ISS Group is committed to making the international community more resilient and just for all people. We encourage diversity and inclusion in their broadest terms, including ethnicity, race, age, gender, gender identity, disability, sexual orientation, religious beliefs, language, culture, and educational background. title: Weekend arbejde hos hypermarked i Skalborg
description: Ansøgningsfrist: 30.juni 2023 Vi søger 2 medarbejdere til vores team hos kunde i Skalborg.Vil du være med til at sikre en god kvalitet der kan tåle fødevarekontrollens tjek. Så læs endelig videre.Du er som medarbejder kvalitetsbevidst, pligtopfyldende, fleksibel og fuld af gåpåmod. Hos ISS bliver du en del af en global serviceorganisation, der ånder for at yde den bedste service for vores kunder. At være en del af ISSSom vores nye kollega, bliver du en del af et spændende arbejdsmiljø, hvor vi sætter en ære i at levere rengøring på et højt niveau. Dine arbejdsopgaver vil primært bestå i at udføre rengøring bageri eller slagteri afdeling hos et hypermarked, har du erfaring med rengøring er det en fordel, men det vigtigste er, at du er detaljeorienteret og har sans for de små detaljer samt er fleksibel og omstillingsparat. Vi har rengøringsopgaver primært om aften/natten. Der vil være mulighed for at få ekstra timer ved sygdom og ferie i hverdagene. Stilling 1 Bager rengøringFredag + lørdag i lige uger, kl.19:00 – 02:30 inkl. 0,5 time selvbetalt pauseStilling 2 Slagter rengøringHver lørdag, kl.22:15 – 04:45 inkl. 0,5 time selvbetalt pause.Udover ovennævnte kompetencer, ser vi gerne at du: Er selvstændig og kan tage ansvar for egne opgaverArbejder i et raskt tempoEr fokuseret, proaktiv og god til at læse kundens behovEr god til at indgå i et team og at samarbejde med andreKan tale og forstå både dansk og engelsk   ISS lever af service - det er derfor også vigtigt, at du er smilende, præsentabel og imødekommende over for både kunder og kolleger, samt er villig til at gøre en forskel for vores kunder. AnsøgningIndsend dit CV, motiveret ansøgning og andre relevante dokumenter via linket 'Ansøg nu' hurtigst muligt og senest d. 30. juni. Vi afholder samtaler løbende, så send din ansøgning i dag frem for i morgen – det kan være dig, vi leder efter.Vi stræber efter at afvikle en inkluderende og retfærdig rekrutteringsproces og lige muligheder for alle kandidater. Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Remé Andersen på 29264973.Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig! ISS is a Place to Be YouBe who you are. Become what you want. Be part of something bigger.Since 1901, ISS has been a people-first company. Diversity and inclusion have always been in our DNA, and our diverse workforce has played a critical role in fostering our innovation and financial growth, expanding our global footprint and positively influencing our company culture. This includes the diversity of age, ethnicity, gender, disabilities, religious beliefs, and cultural backgrounds among others. We recognize the power of diversity and celebrate the differences that makes us unique.We seek to be a place of belonging and create places where people are respected, embraced, and valued for exactly who they are. We take our social obligation seriously to improve lives, make a difference in our communities, and protect our planet. Because when we get things right, the world works better. And that is what drives us.  dk.issworld.com#APlacetoBeYou #LI-DNI

title: Barselsvikar søges til kantine i Odense Er du faglært har en passion for mad - og kan du godt lide
description: Ansøgningsfrist: 26. juni 2023 Er du faglært har en passion for mad – og kan du godt lide at udvikle dig og nytænke retter? Så er dette måske jobbet for dig! Vi søger lige nu en faglært barselsvikar til en af vores kantiner i Odense. Du vil i tæt samarbejde med køkkenchefen være ansvarlig for at servere sund, inspirerende og velsmagende mad til 40-60 gæster. I kantinen er der fokus på sæsonvarer, og der tilbydes morgenmad, frokost samt mødeforplejning til gæsterne.  Da vi er en servicevirksomhed, er det vigtigt, at du er med til at yde den bedste service for vores gæster. Du bliver en del af et team, hvor stemningen er i top og humøret er højt. Du skal derfor være positivt indstillet og have den samme passion for mad og service, som vi har. Samtidig er der hos os plads til, at du kan udvikle dig og nytænke retterne, så gæsterne hver dag får en god spiseoplevelse.  Stillingen er på 37 timer ugentligt med mødetid kl. 06.00-15.00 mandag til fredag.  Vi forventer startdato hurtigst muligt og barselsvikariatet vil vare indtil februar 2024. Den rette kandidat kan sige ja til følgende: Du er faglært kok eller lignende og sætter en ære i at levere på et højt niveau hver dag Du er udadvendt og kan lide at yde en god service til gæsterneDu har øje for anretning og følger med i tidens trendsDu trives i en travl hverdag, hvor vi hjælper hinandenDu er en teamplayer og besidder gode samarbejdsevner, idet du forstår, at vi kun kommer i mål som et team  Ansøgning Lyder stillingen som barselsvikar i vores kantine i Odense som noget for dig, så indsend dit CV, motiveret ansøgning og andre relevante dokumenter via linket 'Ansøg nu' hurtigst muligt og senest d. 26. juni 2023. Vi afholder samtaler løbende, så send din ansøgning i dag frem for i morgen – det kan være dig, vi leder efter.Vi stræber efter at afvikle en inkluderende og retfærdig rekrutteringsproces og lige muligheder for alle kandidater. Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte køkkenchef Heidi Bøgebjerg Rasmussen på tlf: 71 96 59 39 i tidsrummet fra kl. 13:00 – 14:00.Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!  ISS is a Place to Be YouBe who you are. Become what you want. Be part of something bigger.Since 1901, ISS has been a people-first company. Diversity and inclusion have always been in our DNA, and our diverse workforce has played a critical role in fostering our innovation and financial growth, expanding our global footprint and positively influencing our company culture. This includes the diversity of age, ethnicity, gender, disabilities, religious beliefs, and cultural backgrounds among others. We recognize the power of diversity and celebrate the differences that makes us unique.We seek to be a place of belonging and create places where people are respected, embraced, and valued for exactly who they are. We take our social obligation seriously to improve lives, make a difference in our communities, and protect our planet. Because when we get things right, the world works better. And that is what drives us.  dk.issworld.com#APlacetoBeYou #LI-DNI

title: Digital Workplace Specialist - Endpoint Management
description: ISS connects people and places to make the world work better. Are you ready to connect to a place where you belong? At our corporate facilities or at client sites – together, we make places while transforming businesses into having even more positive impact on societies, the environment, and our people. We are searching for experienced Digital Workplace operations specialists to join our Level 2 Digital Workplace operations team. You will join a newly established support organization based out of different ISS countries. In this role you will provide 2nd level support to ISS global end point services. Services cover wide technical scope, but you are not expected to be experienced in all listed below areas.  Your Key Responsibilities:Service requests fulfillment and incidents resolution in the following endpoint management areas:Azure VDI:Application installation / publicationSession host creation / pool creation and updateOn-premises GPO management related to Azure VDIMicrosoft Endpoint Configuration Manager (SCCM) Application package creation / distributionAbility to troubleshoot ConfigMgr client logs and package installation logsOS/MS Office/Software Updates managementoperating system deployment via MEMCM, AutopilotMobile device management (Intune) – Windows, iOS, AndroidTroubleshoot and resolve out of the ordinary technical problems and challengesCollaboration with various stakeholders within the IT landscape (Network team, Security team etc.) and close collaboration with Level 3 engineering team Contribution to Knowledge base development (Develop and maintain repeatable processes documents that govern the configuration, administration and maintenance, best practices, SOPs)Ensuring Customer satisfaction and SLA adherence  Professional & Personal Qualifications:At least 2 years of experience with listed below technologies:SCCM/Configuration ManagerApplication deployment systems, SCCM, WSUS, PDQ, etc.-Endpoint Management (formerly Intune),Familiarity with at least one of the virtualized client technologiesVDI Azure, Citrix Virtual apps, VMware Horizon Experienced in working with ITIL processes (working with ITSM platforms like Jira, Confluence or similar)Experience with client virtualization technologiesCertifications relevant within the area of responsibility for the position are a plus.Fluent English, both written and oral On a personal level you can work independently and stay organized when assigned multiple tasks. Why ISSSince our founding in 1901, ISS has been a people-first company. We recognize the power of diversity and celebrate the differences that make us unique. When everyone is free to be themselves, everyone benefits. Our people feel safe, respected, represented, and supported as their authentic selves, allowing them to seize opportunities and reach their full potential. We take seriously our obligation to improve lives, make a difference in our communities, and protect our planet - because when we get things right, the world works better. And that is what drives us. ISS is a Place to Be You.Be who you are. Become what you want. Be part of something bigger.Become more. Become ISS. How you’ll applyApply directly via the link on this page by submitting a cover letter, CV and other relevant documents for the position you are applying for.We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible. ISS seeks to BE a place of belonging and CREATE places where every person is welcomed, embraced, and valued for exactly who they are. Places where people feel safe, respected, represented, and supported as their authentic selves.

title: Cleaner Part Time
description: ISS offers a competitive compensation package including Benefits, Paid Time Off, and a starting hourly salary of $13.87 USD.  Key PurposeJanitors keep assigned areas, such as offices, commercial spaces, industrial spaces, or institutional buildings, in clean and orderly condition. You will work successfully with fellow employees, clients, and all levels of the organization. You are expected to understand and follow instructions, both verbal and written; and explain how to complete a task using basic communication skills.  Success CriteriaComply with safety rules, policies, and proceduresPerform work assignments in a team with other employeesMaintain clean work areaFollow all company procedures, policies, and rulesTake direction and respond to supervisionCommunicate with the lead, supervisor, co-workers, managers, and customers professionallyFill in during staff shortageSupport shift lead in completing punch-list itemsUse proper personal protective equipmentPresent a professional appearance and conductUnderstand customer service and satisfactionUnderstand reporting systems and the environmentInstilling trust  Key Areas of Collaboration and InfluenceA solid commitment to the guest experienceAlways remember safety firstBuild respectful relationships with all teammates and guestsWillingness to take directions from the
